unit_learning_outcomes.description: Demonstrate self-awareness through identifying and setting targets for time management of assessment completion
Critically evaluate the relevance and accuracy of neuroscience data in order to formulate evidence based arguments
Effectively communicate concepts in psychopharmacology using information technology and in written and oral formats.
Demonstrate knowledge of the neuropharmacology of common psychological disorders and pharmacotherapies for these disorders.
Critically evaluate research literature and theoretical issues relevant to psychopharmacology.

assessments.description: Students are required to present and critique a journal article in oral format for 10 minutes
Students submit a 1500 word essay on a contemporary psychopharmacology topic.
Forty multiple choice questions in 1 hour
Students are expected to participate in class discussions particularly during oral presentations to foster an understanding and critical evaluation of research papers that are read prior to class

school.value: Faculty of Medicine, Health and Human Sciences

data.description: This unit provides an overview of the basic principles of neuropharmacology with particular emphasis on the disorders seen in the clinical practice of neuropsychologists and clinical psychologists. It begins with a review of basic principles and then covers the major neurotransmitter systems and how they are disordered in brain injury and psychological disorders such as depression, schizophrenia and the anxiety disorders.
data.title: Clinical Neuropsychopharmacology

title: Clinical Neuropsychopharmacology
